flight_path_summary: Flew at 150m height, came within 50m of aircraft
description: Unknown drone sighted by pilots, leading to a 45-minute closure of the Polderbaan runway. Investigation yielded no results.

flight_path_summary: Spotted above the air traffic control tower.
description: Drone spotted over control tower, labeled 'potential espionage'. Marechaussee found nothing. Another drone was seen weeks before.

flight_path_summary: Flew over the power plant.
description: At least one drone, possibly more, flew over the nuclear plant in 2025. Origin unknown.

flight_path_summary: Spotted over the port area.
description: Drones were spotted over the Port of Antwerp, prompting an investigation by shipping police.

flight_path_summary: Coordinated wave of drone sightings over multiple airports, military bases, and a nuclear site.
description: Coordinated 'hybrid' campaign with disruptions at Brussels Airport (Nov 4-5), Liège Airport (Nov 6-7), and sightings over SCK CEN, Kleine-Brogel, and Florennes bases.

flight_path_summary: Spotted flying over the base at night.
description: 'Exceptional' incident involving multiple small drones over a key army training base.

flight_path_summary: Sighted by pilot on approach, runway closed.
description: Runway was closed for approx 45 mins after a pilot reported a drone during approach. No drone was found by authorities.

flight_path_summary: Multiple sightings over several days.
description: Major disruption over several days (Oct 2-4) due to multiple drone sightings, leading to ~170 cancellations and 15 diversions.

flight_path_summary: Sighted by witness and police patrol.
description: Flight operations suspended for approximately two hours in the evening after a drone was spotted by a witness and confirmed by a police patrol.

flight_path_summary: Repeated flights over plant, LNG terminal, and chemical park.
description: Repeated, systematic flights over multiple critical infrastructure sites, including the decommissioned nuclear plant. Official investigation for espionage/sabotage is active.

flight_path_summary: Dangerous approach to a passenger aircraft.
description: An unauthorized drone flew dangerously close to a passenger plane, causing the temporary closure of the airport and flight diversions.

flight_path_summary: Jammed communications of Dutch soldiers.
description: During NATO exercise 'Falcon Autumn', unidentified drones appeared over an airfield used by Dutch soldiers, causing communication jamming.

location: Nowe Miasto nad Pilicą Military Base
flight_path_summary: Crashed on base territory after violating airspace.
description: A drone that violated Polish airspace from the east (during RU-UA conflict) crashed on the territory of the military base.

flight_path_summary: Multiple drones violated airspace, some shot down.
description: Major air defense incident where multiple drones violated airspace from the east. Some were shot down by Polish/allied aircraft, prompting a high alert.

flight_path_summary: Crashed, damaging cars.
description: A Polish military training drone crashed in an urban area, damaging cars.

flight_path_summary: Sighted near runway, causing temporary suspension.
description: Civilian drone sighted near the runway, leading to temporary suspension of landings.

flight_path_summary: Sighted near runway.
description: Another civilian drone sighted near the runway, part of a series of incidents at the airport.

flight_path_summary: Multiple sightings (Apr 15-17), electronic jamming used.
description: Wave of drone sightings (3 on Apr 15-16, 1 on Apr 17) near key NATO hub, prompting military countermeasures (jamming) and investigation.

flight_path_summary: 16 incidents reported by Air Force by May 2024.
description: Official report from Romanian Air Force Staff details 16 drone security incidents at key air bases: M. Kogălniceanu (7), Borcea (2), Otopeni (1), Câmpia Turzii (6).

location: Copenhagen, Aalborg, Billund, Esbjerg, Sønderborg Airports & multiple military bases
flight_path_summary: Coordinated flights over multiple airports and military bases.
description: Major coordinated 'hybrid operation' involving large drones over multiple key airports and military bases (Skrydstrup, Karup, Holstebro), causing widespread disruption and a national drone ban.

flight_path_summary: Paralyzed airport, diverting 21 flights.
description: Two drones paralyzed the airport, forcing 21 flights to be diverted.

flight_path_summary: Closed airspace for 35 minutes, diverting 8 flights.
description: A drone sighting closed the airspace for 35 minutes, forcing 8 flights to be diverted.

flight_path_summary: Sighted, causing flight traffic to be stopped.
description: Flight traffic was halted after one or more drones were observed, prompting an investigation into suspected air traffic sabotage.

flight_path_summary: Sighted during the night, causing temporary closure.
description: Four drones were observed during the night, leading to a temporary airport closure and flight diversions. Investigation for sabotage initiated.

flight_path_summary: One drone shot down with anti-drone weapon.
description: Two drones spotted near base housing US troops; one was shot down.

flight_path_summary: Wreckage and impact crater found.
description: Wreckage of an attack drone found, suspected to be a Ukrainian drone targeting Russia that was diverted by jamming.

flight_path_summary: Violated airspace from the direction of Russia.
description: A small object, likely a drone, violated Estonian airspace from Russia for 18 minutes.

flight_path_summary: Fragment found on the coast.
description: A drone fragment was found on the coast; it is unconfirmed if it entered Estonian airspace before crashing.

flight_path_summary: Two incidents in one day, operations stopped in the morning, another drone sighted later with pilot detained.
description: Two separate drone incidents disrupted Vilnius Airport; one in the morning stopped traffic, a second in the afternoon led to the pilot's detention.

flight_path_summary: Multiple incidents in September (9, 11, 25) and one involving the presidential plane (Sep 2).
description: A series of drone incidents disrupted Vilnius airport throughout September, including on the 9th, 11th, and 25th, and one which forced the presidential aircraft to circle on Sep 2nd.

flight_path_summary: Flights suspended for approx. 30 minutes around midnight.
description: Vilnius airport operations were suspended for about 30 minutes around midnight due to a drone sighting in the city.

flight_path_summary: Entered from Belarus and crashed after 3 minutes.
description: A Russian-made Gerbera drone, visually similar to a Shahed, entered Lithuanian airspace from Belarus and crashed. Another incursion was reported July 28.

flight_path_summary: Wreckage of drone carrying explosive charge found.
description: The wreckage of an unidentified drone carrying an explosive charge was discovered at a military training ground in the Jonava district.

flight_path_summary: Operator detained, claimed to be filming for advertising.
description: A drone was detected over the NATO Air Policing base at Šiauliai. The operator was detained by Military Police.
